text.__SUMMARY__: Conus garciai is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Distribution: This species occurs in the Caribbean Sea off Belize, Honduras and Panama.
text.Description: The maximum recorded shell length is 69 mm.
text.Habitat: Minimum recorded depth is 37 m. Maximum recorded depth is 49 m.
text.References:
Filmer R.M. (2001). A Catalogue of Nomenclature and Taxonomy in the Living Conidae 1758 - 1998. Backhuys Publishers, Leiden. 388pp

Puillandre N., Duda T.F., Meyer C., Olivera B.M. & Bouchet P. (2015). One, four or 100 genera? A new classification of the cone snails. Journal of Molluscan Studies. 81: 1-23
